FAQs.Question: What is the PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: PUMAA is a dynamic insurance platform supporting multiple Managing General Agents (MGAs) across various lines of businessâ€”Personal, Commercial, and Professional.

FAQs.Question: How do I get a quote in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: First, log in. Then, select the New Quote button. Next, choose the coverage. After that, select the office, state, and coverage options.

FAQs.Question: Who do I contact for support?
FAQs.Answer: For assistance, please email support@pumaa.com or utilize the in-app help feature.

FAQs.Question: How do I reset my password in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Click 'Forgot Password' on the login screen. Then, enter your username and click the Submit button. You will receive an email with a link to reset your password.

FAQs.Question: Can I access PUMAA from mobile devices?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA is accessible from most modern smartphones and tablets via your web browser.

FAQs.Question: Does PUMAA support multiple users and roles?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA supports multiple users and roles with role-based access control (RBAC) for enhanced security and operational efficiency.

FAQs.Question: Is my data secure in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA uses secure servers, firewalls, encryption protocols, and HTTPS via SSL to protect your data.

FAQs.Question: How do I update my agency information?
FAQs.Answer: Navigate to Settings > Agency Profile to update your agency details.

FAQs.Question: How do I download policy documents?
FAQs.Answer: Go to the policy dashboard, select your policy, and click 'Download Documents'.

FAQs.Question: Is training available for new users?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA offers onboarding and training resources for new users.

FAQs.Question: How do I submit a claim in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Navigate to the Claims section, select your policy, and follow the guided steps to submit a new claim.

FAQs.Question: Can I track claim status in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, you can view and track the status of all submitted claims from your dashboard.

FAQs.Question: Does PUMAA support electronic signatures?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA supports secure electronic signatures for policy documents and endorsements.

FAQs.Question: Can I customize user permissions in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, administrators can define roles and assign tailored permissions using RBAC.

FAQs.Question: How do I renew a policy in PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: Go to the policy dashboard, select the policy, and click 'Renew Policy'. Follow the prompts to complete renewal.

FAQs.Question: Does PUMAA offer reporting and analytics?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA provides built-in reporting tools and analytics dashboards for policy, claims, and user activity.

FAQs.Question: Can I export data from PUMAA?
FAQs.Answer: You can export policy, claims, and user data in various formats from the Reports section.

FAQs.Question: How do I update billing or payment information?
FAQs.Answer: Navigate to 'Settings' > 'Billing' to update your payment methods and billing details.

FAQs.Question: Does PUMAA support bulk data import?
FAQs.Answer: Yes, PUMAA allows bulk import of policies, claims, and contacts via CSV or Excel files.

FAQs.Question: What is a premium?
FAQs.Answer: Premium is the amount of money you pay to an insurance company in exchange for coverage.

FAQs.Question: What is a claim?
FAQs.Answer: Claim is a formal request made by a policyholder to an insurance company asking for payment or services covered under their insurance policy.

FAQs.Question: What is renewal?
FAQs.Answer: Renewal is the process of extending your insurance policy for another term after the current coverage period ends.

FAQs.Question: What is an effective date?
FAQs.Answer: Effective Date is the date when your insurance coverage officially begins.

FAQs.Question: What is an endorsement?
FAQs.Answer: Endorsement is a written amendment or addition to an existing insurance policy that changes its terms, coverage, or conditions.

FAQs.Question: What is a premium adjustment?
FAQs.Answer: Premium Adjustment is a change in the amount you pay for your insurance, usually calculated after the policy period based on actual exposure or risk.

FAQs.Question: What is the difference between commercial and personal coverage?
FAQs.Answer: Commercial Coverage protects businesses and their assets. Personal Coverage protects individuals and families.

FAQs.Question: What is a policy limit?
FAQs.Answer: Policy Limit is the maximum amount an insurance company will pay for a covered loss.

FAQs.Question: What does coverage mean?
FAQs.Answer: Coverage refers to the protection provided by an insurance policy.

FAQs.Question: What is a claim settlement?
FAQs.Answer: Claim Settlement is the process by which an insurance company reviews, approves, and pays out the amount owed to a policyholder for a covered claim.
